hero.title: A calm place to read books online
hero.subtitle: Clean reading experience. Thousands of books. No distractions.
hero.description: TextStack is a free online library of classic and public-domain books. Read literature by famous authors directly in your browser — no downloads, no distractions.

seo.content: Textstack is an online platform designed for comfortable reading. The current catalog features classic literature and public-domain works by authors from different eras and traditions. Each book is organized into chapters for easy navigation. The platform is built for readers who prefer a distraction-free reading experience.

about.seoDesc: TextStack is an independent online library for classic literature. Created by Vasyl Vdovychenko — making timeless books accessible to everyone.
about.title: About
about.intro: TextStack is an independent online library dedicated to public domain literature — books that belong to everyone.
about.body1: Every book here is free to read, share, and enjoy. No ads, no accounts, no barriers. Just clean typography, calm reading, and timeless stories that have shaped generations.
about.mission1: We believe that access to the world's great literature is a fundamental right. In an age of digital distraction and paywalls, TextStack provides a sanctuary for focused, deep reading.
about.mission2: Our digital editions are meticulously formatted to respect the author's intent while providing a modern, accessible reading experience across all devices.

creator.heading: The Creator
creator.bio1: I built TextStack because I believe in the transformative power of reading — and that classic literature should be available to anyone, anywhere, without friction.
creator.bio2: This is a long-term passion project. If you share this vision or want to connect, I'd love to hear from you.

contact.seoDesc: Get in touch with TextStack. We'd love to hear your feedback, questions, or content requests.
contact.title: Contact Us
contact.intro: We'd love to hear from you. Whether it's feedback, a question, or a book request — drop us a line.
contact.responseBody: TextStack is a passion project maintained by a small team. We read every message and will do our best to respond promptly, but please allow a few days for a reply.

privacy.seoDesc: TextStack privacy policy. We collect minimal data and respect your privacy. No accounts required for reading.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy matters. TextStack is designed to let you read freely without surveillance or data harvesting.
privacy.collectBody1: TextStack collects minimal data. You can browse and read any book in our library without creating an account or providing personal information.
privacy.collectBody2: If you choose to use optional features like saving reading progress or bookmarks, this data is stored locally in your browser. We do not track what you read or share this information with third parties.
privacy.cookiesBody1: We use essential cookies only to remember your preferences (like dark mode settings). We do not use advertising cookies or tracking pixels.
privacy.cookiesBody2: Basic analytics may be collected to understand general usage patterns and improve the service, but this data is anonymized and not linked to individual users.
privacy.thirdPartiesBody: We do not sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties. We do not display advertisements or use third-party tracking services.
privacy.storageBody1: Reading preferences, progress, and bookmarks are stored locally in your browser using standard web storage APIs. You can clear this data at any time through your browser settings.
privacy.storageBody2: If you upload personal books to your library, these files are stored securely and are only accessible to you.
privacy.rightsBody: You have the right to access, correct, or delete any personal data we may hold. Since we collect minimal data, there's usually nothing to delete — but if you have questions, please contact us.
privacy.contactBody: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please reach out at

terms.seoDesc: TextStack terms of service. Read about acceptable use, content policies, and your rights as a user.
terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: By using TextStack, you agree to these terms. They're designed to be fair and straightforward.
terms.acceptanceBody: By accessing or using TextStack, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you disagree with any part of these terms, you may not access the service.
terms.contentBody1: TextStack provides access to public domain literature — works whose copyright has expired and that belong to the public. These books are free to read, share, and enjoy.
terms.contentBody2: Users may upload their own books to their personal library. You are responsible for ensuring you have the right to upload and access any content you add to the platform.
terms.useIntro: You agree to use TextStack respectfully and lawfully. This means:
terms.use1: Not attempting to disrupt or overload the service
terms.use2: Not scraping content for commercial purposes
terms.use3: Not uploading malicious files or content
terms.use4: Respecting the intellectual property rights of others
terms.ipBody1: The public domain books in our library are free for anyone to use. However, the TextStack platform, design, and original content are protected by copyright.
terms.ipBody2: We credit sources where applicable and strive to provide accurate information about each work's origin and status.
terms.disclaimerBody1: TextStack is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. While we strive to maintain accurate texts and reliable service, we cannot guarantee uninterrupted access or error-free content.
terms.disclaimerBody2: We are not liable for any damages arising from your use of the service.
terms.changesBody: We may update these terms from time to time. Significant changes will be communicated through the website. Your continued use of TextStack after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
